DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia Family Medical History Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator for information related to a family history of the most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia. It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States. Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia Family Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to a family history of the most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia. It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States. Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia, and comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  The clinical course is indolent, but this type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia.  It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  This type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001)

Property.preferredDefinition: Chronological record of health and disease events of family members and ancestors. (WEBS84)

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives. A patient's family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
